meanings.definition: Relating to the geography of ancient times.
meanings.sent1: The paleogeographic map showed where ancient rivers and mountains once existed.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use paleogeographic data to understand how the Earth's surface has changed over time.
meanings.sent3: The paleogeographic puzzle was challenging, but the researchers finally pieced it together.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a paleogeographic landscape, filled with memories of long-forgotten places.
meanings.sent5: The paleogeographic images painted a vivid picture of the world millions of years ago.

meanings.definition: Study of the geographical features of past eras.
meanings.sent1: Paleogeographic helps us learn about the Earth's history through its ancient landscapes.
meanings.sent2: The paleogeographic research revealed fascinating details about prehistoric environments.
meanings.sent3: During the paleogeographic class, students explored maps of ancient terrains.
meanings.sent4: The paleogeographic study opened a window to the past, showing us how the world used to look.
meanings.sent5: His passion for paleogeographic made him an expert in understanding ancient geographies.

meanings.definition: Describing the land formations of a previous geological period.
meanings.sent1: The paleogeographic layers in the rock formations indicated a different era in Earth's history.
meanings.sent2: The paleogeographic features of the region suggested a time when glaciers covered the land.
meanings.sent3: The paleogeographic patterns on the map resembled a painting by a geological artist.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams were filled with paleogeographic landscapes, transporting her to ancient times.
meanings.sent5: The paleogeographic descriptions painted a vivid picture of the Earth's past environments.
